metadata.subject: Invitation to be a featured guest on Poetry in America

relationships.description: Professor inviting Ms. Williams to participate in her television series
Elisa New is the Powell M. Cabot Professor of American Literature at Harvard
Partnership for creating online course for medical professionals

analysis.purpose: To invite Ms. Williams to participate as a featured guest on the Poetry in America television series
analysis.significance: Shows academic and media outreach efforts by Harvard professor to prominent individuals for educational programming

notable_quotes: You are the ideal reader for this poem: indeed, I picked it for the season in hopes you would be my co-interpreter.

The poem I'd like to read and interpret with you is by Pulitzer Prize winner, Sharon Olds, and it's called 'The Language of the Brag.' It's a gutsy poem that compares feats of (male) athletic prowess-- and feats of poetic prowess-- to childbirth.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present - this is a standard professional invitation

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is a legitimate academic/media invitation

details: Mention of streaming services and airline distribution
Discussion of media production and distribution

public_knowledge.context: Poetry in America is a publicly broadcast television series with notable guests, consistent with academic media outreach programs

analysis.summary: Harvard Professor Elisa New invites Ms. Williams to be a featured guest on her public television series Poetry in America to interpret Sharon Olds' poem 'The Language of the Brag,' highlighting the show's prestigious guest list and multiple distribution platforms including public television, Amazon Prime, and airlines.
